snippet: The brain of an American Indian known as the Last Wild Man in America was handed over today to a tribe from Northern California after being stored at the Smithsonian Institution for more than 80 years.     Members of the Seven Pit River Indian tri...
lead_paragraph: The brain of an American Indian known as the Last Wild Man in America was handed over today to a tribe from Northern California after being stored at the Smithsonian Institution for more than 80 years. Members of the Seven Pit River Indian tribe performed a private religious ceremony at the Natural History Museum here before accepting the remains, said Randall Kremer, a museum spokesman.
abstract: Smithsonian Institution hands over to Northern California Indian tribe brain of last member of Yahi tribe, which it held for over 80 years; Indians plan to reunite brain with man's cremated remains and bury both near Mount Lassen; man, who emerged from wilderness in 1911, was treated as living link to Stone Age, making spears, bows and arrows as visitors watched (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Last Yahi Indian's Brain Is Returned to a Tribe
